title: Online Social and Health Education Learning Program Based on the ICAP Framework for Childbirth Education and Self-Efficacy Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and substantial practical experience in specialized fields, basic understanding of social and health education, and participation in civic engagement activities
context.additional_context: Self-directed learning in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Designed as an educational program for community health promotion and civic engagement enhancement, learners interact with peers from diverse cultural backgrounds to build social support networks.

learning_goals: Learners will explain the physiological benefits of upright posture and mobility during childbirth and propose three practical methods including social support system establishment.
Learners will achieve a 20% improvement in self-efficacy through positive attitude formation toward childbirth education and self-assessment surveys, enhancing awareness of health rights as citizens.

Learners will apply the four ICAP framework activity types (Active, Constructive, Interactive, Passive) to derive three creative problem-solving strategies (e.g., role optimization, resource constraint overcoming, simulation scenario improvement) in a childbirth simulation project, achieving 4+ points (on a 5-point scale) in two or more rubric items (creativity, feasibility, effectiveness) and strengthening collaborative problem-solving competencies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
